Executable files found in unusual locati.Action: Collect Windows Event ID 4688 from Endpoints and Servers. Extract Process Name, Process Path, and Command Line. Compare Process Path against a baseline of standard locations for common system processes. Identify processes with names similar to system processes but running from unusual directories. Use frequency analysis or statistical profiling to flag processes running from low-prevalence paths or originating from unusual parent processes.

Suspicious file names containing obfusca.Action: Collect Windows Event ID 4688 from Endpoints and Servers. Extract Command Line and Process Path. Scan Command Line strings for the presence of obfuscating characters (e.g., non-printable UTF-8). Identify executions of common system utilities (e.g., powershell.exe, cmd.exe) and analyze their command line arguments for suspicious patterns (e.g., encoding, hidden windows). Correlate suspicious process executions (Event ID 4688) with outbound network connections in Zeek conn.log initiated shortly after process creation.
